body_html:
My concern is, we have very numerical differences.
It is possible TF is just not working on ppc64le, and it needs to be fixed.
If we suppress these warnings, sure you might have all tests passing, but people using TF may run into worse issues getting wrong outputs, models not converging, etc.

IMO these numerical differences are too large to ignore, and will cause issues using TF on ppc platform. Therefore, I am against changing tolerances fro 1e-6 to 10. You can just create a fork of TensorFlow and make those changes there. But I think you will eventually need to debug and get to the bottom of these differences, because they look like real bugs with TF on ppc64le to me.
